query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Era già l’ora che volge il disio 2 ai navicanti e ’ntenerisce il core 3 lo dì c’han detto ai dolci amici addio;
query.error: **English:** 1 It was already the hour that turns the desire 2 of sailors to the shore and melts their hearts 3 on the day they have said farewell to their sweet friends;
query.result: 1 Wæs ða seo tid ðe gewunað ðæt sefa 2 scipfara and hyra mod geblissad 3 ðone dæg ðe hi ða leofan leoda

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e che lo novo peregrin d’amore 5 punge, se ode squilla di lontano 6 che paia il giorno pianger che si more;
query.error: **English:** 4 and that pierces the new pilgrim of love 5 if he hears from afar the bell 6 that seems to mourn the dying day;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 quand’ io incominciai a render vano 8 l’udire e a mirare una de l’alme 9 surta, che l’ascoltar chiedea con mano.
query.error: **English:** 7 when I began to lose the power 8 of hearing and to gaze at one of the souls 9 who had risen and was asking to be heard with her hand.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Ella giunse e levò ambo le palme, 11 ficcando li occhi verso l’orïente, 12 come dicesse a Dio: ‘D’altro non calme’.
query.error: **English:** 10 She arrived and raised both her palms, 11 fixing her eyes toward the east, 12 as if to say to God: ‘I care for nothing else’.
query.result: 10 Heo ðær com and ða handa up ahof, 11 ða eagan on ðone eastweard fæste, 12 swilce heo wolde secgan to ðam Scyppende: ‘Ic elles noht ne gyme’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 ‘Te lucis ante’ sì devotamente 14 le uscìo di bocca e con sì dolci note, 15 che fece me a me uscir di mente;
query.error: **English:** 13 ‘Te lucis ante’ she uttered so devoutly 14 from her mouth and with such sweet notes, 15 that it made me lose myself in thought;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 e l’altre poi dolcemente e devote 17 seguitar lei per tutto l’inno intero, 18 avendo li occhi a le superne rote.
query.error: **English:** 16 and then the others followed her sweetly and devoutly 17 throughout the entire hymn, 18 with their eyes fixed on the heavenly spheres.
query.result: 16 and ða oðre ða swiðe softe and ðeodlice 17 folgodon hire ðurh ðone halgan stefn, 18 and ða eagan hæfdon to ðam heofonlican hweofle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Aguzza qui, lettor, ben li occhi al vero, 20 ché ’l velo è ora ben tanto sottile, 21 certo che ’l trapassar dentro è leggero.
query.error: **English:** 19 Sharpen your eyes here, reader, to the truth, 20 for the veil is now so thin, 21 that surely it is easy to pass through it.
query.result: 19 Hlyste nu ðu ðe lærest ðis, 20 forðæm ðe ðes wælrest is nu ðunne, 21 ðæt ðu miht ðurh ðone wælrest geseon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Io vidi quello essercito gentile 23 tacito poscia riguardare in sùe, 24 quasi aspettando, palido e umìle;
query.error: **English:** 22 I saw that noble army 23 silently looking up, 24 as if waiting, pale and humble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 e vidi uscir de l’alto e scender giùe 26 due angeli con due spade affocate, 27 tronche e private de le punte sue.
query.error: **English:** 25 and I saw two angels come down from above, 26 with two flaming swords, 27 broken and deprived of their points.
query.result: 25 and ic ða geseah of ðam heofonum cuman 26 twegen englas mid twam byrnum sweordum, 27 towrecene and berofene heora scearpra ecga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Verdi come fogliette pur mo nate 29 erano in veste, che da verdi penne 30 percosse traean dietro e ventilate.
query.error: **English:** 28 Green like newly born leaves 29 were they in their robes, which by green feathers 30 beaten and blown behind them were ventilated.
query.result: 28 Grene as gres þat groweþ in May, 29 Icladde hem in a sute of silk, 30 I-corven and i-sewed so fetisly,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 L’un poco sovra noi a star si venne, 32 e l’altro scese in l’opposita sponda, 33 sì che la gente in mezzo si contenne.
query.error: **English:** 31 One of them came a little above us, 32 and the other descended to the opposite bank, 33 so that the people in the middle were contained.
query.result: 31 Se wæs sum healice ofer us on staðe, 32 and se oðer nyðer on ðære sælidan, 33 swa ðæt ða leode on middele wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Ben discernëa in lor la testa bionda; 35 ma ne la faccia l’occhio si smarria, 36 come virtù ch’a troppo si confonda.
query.error: **English:** 34 I could clearly see his blond head; 35 but my eyes were lost in his face, 36 like a power that is confounded by too much.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 «Ambo vegnon del grembo di Maria», 38 disse Sordello, «a guardia de la valle, 39 per lo serpente che verrà vie via».
query.error: **English:** 37 "Both come from the womb of Mary," 38 said Sordello, "to guard the valley, 39 because of the serpent that will come soon."
query.result: 37 "Begen cumað of Marian mearh," 38 cwæð Sordello, "to weardanne ðone wudu, 39 for ðam wyrme ðe cymeð sona."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Ond’ io, che non sapeva per qual calle, 41 mi volsi intorno, e stretto m’accostai, 42 tutto gelato, a le fidate spalle.
query.error: **English:** 40 And I, who did not know which way to go, 41 turned around and, trembling, 42 drew close to my faithful shoulders.
query.result: 40 Ond ic, ðe ne cuðe hwæt ic don scolde, 41 ic me onbæc bewende, and fæste me geclungon, 42 eal forhtigende, to ðam treowum me on bæc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E Sordello anco: «Or avvalliamo omai 44 tra le grandi ombre, e parleremo ad esse; 45 grazïoso fia lor vedervi assai».
query.error: **English:** 43 And Sordello again: "Now let us descend 44 among the great shades, and we will speak to them; 45 it will be gracious for them to see you."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Solo tre passi credo ch’i’ scendesse, 47 e fui di sotto, e vidi un che mirava 48 pur me, come conoscer mi volesse.
query.error: **English:** 46 I think I had descended only three steps, 47 and I was below, and I saw someone who was looking 48 only at me, as if he wanted to recognize me.
query.result: 46 Ic wene ðæt ic ne eode ða furðor ðonne ðreo stapas, 47 and ic wæs ða neoðan, and ic ða geseah ðær sumne ðe on me locade, 48 swilce he me cnawan wolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Temp’ era già che l’aere s’annerava, 50 ma non sì che tra li occhi suoi e ’ miei 51 non dichiarisse ciò che pria serrava.
query.error: **English:** 49 It was already the hour when the air grows dark, 50 but not so that between his eyes and mine 51 it did not reveal what it had previously concealed.
query.result: 49 Þa wæs seo tid ða ðe lyft lædde, 50 ac na swa ðeah ðæt betwux his eagum and minum 51 ne cube ðæt ðe ær forholen wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Ver’ me si fece, e io ver’ lui mi fei: 53 giudice Nin gentil, quanto mi piacque 54 quando ti vidi non esser tra ’ rei!
query.error: **English:** 52 He turned to me, and I to him: 53 Gentle judge, how much it pleased me 54 when I saw you were not among the kings!
query.result: 52 He gewende him to me, and ic to him me gewende: 53 milde dema, hu micel wæs min gefean 54 ða ic ðe geseah ðæt ðu nære mid ðam cyninge!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Nullo bel salutar tra noi si tacque; 56 poi dimandò: «Quant’ è che tu venisti 57 a piè del monte per le lontane acque?».
query.error: **English:** 55 No beautiful greeting was silent between us; 56 then he asked: "How long is it since you came 57 to the foot of the mountain by the distant waters?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «per entro i luoghi tristi 59 venni stamane, e sono in prima vita, 60 ancor che l’altra, sì andando, acquisti».
query.error: **English:** 58 "Oh!" I said to him, "through the sad places 59 I came this morning, and I am in the early part of my life, 60 although I may acquire the other part, if I keep going."
query.result: 58 "Eala," cwæð ic him, "ðurh ða dreorighleoðu 59 ic com ðisne morgen, and ic eom on frymðe lifes, 60 ðeah ðe ic ðone oðerne, swa farende, geceose."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 E come fu la mia risposta udita, 62 Sordello ed elli in dietro si raccolse 63 come gente di sùbito smarrita.
query.error: **English:** 61 And when my answer was heard, 62 Sordello and he drew back 63 like people suddenly bewildered.
query.result: 61 And ða ða min andsware wæs gehyred, 62 Sordello and he on bæc him gewendon 63 swa swa men ðe bēoð on fyrhtu afyllede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 L’uno a Virgilio e l’altro a un si volse 65 che sedea lì, gridando: «Sù, Currado! 66 vieni a veder che Dio per grazia volse».
query.error: **English:** 64 One turned to Virgil and the other to one 65 who was sitting there, crying out: "Up, Currado! 66 Come and see what God in his grace has willed."
query.result: 64 Se wende ða oder to Virgilie and oder to ðam 65 ðe ðær sæt, cleopiende: "Aris, Currado! 66 cum to seon hwæt ðe God for gife sealde."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 67 Þa, gewend to me: "For ðam anlicum grade 68 ðe ðu scealt to ðam ðe swa hylt 69 his forma hwi, ðæt ðær nis nan wæd,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 quando sarai di là da le larghe onde, 71 dì a Giovanna mia che per me chiami 72 là dove a li ’nnocenti si risponde.
query.error: **English:** 70 when you are beyond the broad waves, 71 tell my Giovanna to call upon me 72 there where the innocent are answered.
query.result: 70 ðonne ðu bist ofer ða bradan brimu, 71 sege ðære minre Iohanne ðæt heo for me bidde 72 ðær ðær ðam unscyldigum is andsware."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Non credo che la sua madre più m’ami, 74 poscia che trasmutò le bianche bende, 75 le quai convien che, misera!, ancor brami.
query.error: **English:** 73 I do not believe that his mother loves me any more, 74 since she changed the white swaddling clothes, 75 which, alas, she must still desire.
query.result: 73 Ne wene ic ðæt his modor me mare lufige, 74 siððan heo ða hwitan claðas awende, 75 ða ðe heo, earmre, gyt wilnian sceal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Per lei assai di lieve si comprende 77 quanto in femmina foco d’amor dura, 78 se l’occhio o ’l tatto spesso non l’accende.
query.error: **English:** 76 Through her it is easily understood 77 how long the fire of love lasts in a woman, 78 if the eye or the touch does not often kindle it.
query.result: 76 Þurh hi mon mæg swipe geþencean 77 hu longe on wife lufe fyr wunað, 78 gif ðæt gesihð oððe gesmeah hit ne ontendeð oft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Non le farà sì bella sepultura 80 la vipera che Melanesi accampa, 81 com’ avria fatto il gallo di Gallura».
query.error: **English:** 79 The viper that encamps in Milan 80 will not make so fair a tomb for her 81 as would have done the cock of Gallura.
query.result: 79 Ne hire wyrðeð swa fæger byrgen 80 næddre seo ðe on Melane wunað, 81 swa ðe ðæs hanan hæfde Gallican.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Così dicea, segnato de la stampa, 83 nel suo aspetto, di quel dritto zelo 84 che misuratamente in core avvampa.
query.error: **English:** 82 Thus he spoke, marked with the imprint, 83 in his countenance, of that righteous zeal 84 which glows with moderation in the heart.
query.result: 82 Swa he cwæð, getacnod on ðære stæmpe, 83 on his ansyne, ðæs rihtan ieles, 84 ðe gemetlice on ðam mode byrnende wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Li occhi miei ghiotti andavan pur al cielo, 86 pur là dove le stelle son più tarde, 87 sì come rota più presso a lo stelo.
query.error: **English:** 85 My greedy eyes kept going to the sky, 86 right to where the stars are slowest, 87 like a wheel closest to the axle.
query.result: 85 Mine aglæcan eagan up to heofenum, 86 ðær ða steorran ða selestan synt, 87 swa swa hweol ðam næfe neahst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 E ’l duca mio: «Figliuol, che là sù guarde?». 89 E io a lui: «A quelle tre facelle 90 di che ’l polo di qua tutto quanto arde».
query.error: **English:** 88 And my guide: "My son, what are you looking at up there?". 89 And I to him: "At those three torches 90 with which the pole here is all aflame".
query.result: 88 And min lárēow cwæð: "Sunu mín, hwæt ðu ðær uppan locast?". 89 And ic him andwyrde: "Þám þrim leohte 90 ðe ðone pol héron ealne ontendeð".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Ond’ elli a me: «Le quattro chiare stelle 92 che vedevi staman, son di là basse, 93 e queste son salite ov’ eran quelle».
query.error: **English:** 91 And he said to me: "The four bright stars 92 that you saw this morning are now low in the sky, 93 and these have risen where those were."
query.result: 91 Ond he cwæð to me: "Þa feower beorhte steorran 92 þe þu gesawe þisne morgen, synd nu þær beneoðan, 93 and þas synd upp astigende þær þa wæron."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Com’ ei parlava, e Sordello a sé il trasse 95 dicendo: «Vedi là ’l nostro avversaro»; 96 e drizzò il dito perché ’n là guardasse.
query.error: **English:** 94 As he spoke, Sordello drew him aside, 95 saying: "See there our adversary"; 96 and he pointed his finger so that he would look there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Da quella parte onde non ha riparo 98 la picciola vallea, era una biscia, 99 forse qual diede ad Eva il cibo amaro.
query.error: **English:** 97 On that side where there is no shelter, 98 in the little valley, there was a serpent, 99 perhaps the same one that gave Eve the bitter food.
query.result: 97 On ðære healfe ðær nan heolstor nis, 98 on ðære lytlan dene, wæs an næddre, 99 mægðe ðære ðe ðone bitran æt gaf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Tra l’erba e ’ fior venìa la mala striscia, 101 volgendo ad ora ad or la testa, e ’l dosso 102 leccando come bestia che si liscia.
query.error: **English:** 100 Among the grass and flowers came the evil serpent, 101 turning its head and back now and then, 102 licking itself like a beast that is grooming itself.
query.result: 100 Betwux ðam grase and ðam blostmum com ðæt yfele wyrm, 101 wendan ða hwile his heafod and his hrycg, 102 liccian hine sylfne swa ðæt deor ðe hine geglengð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Io non vidi, e però dicer non posso, 104 come mosser li astor celestïali; 105 ma vidi bene e l’uno e l’altro mosso.
query.error: **English:** 103 I did not see, and therefore cannot say, 104 how the celestial hawks moved; 105 but I saw clearly that both of them moved.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Sentendo fender l’aere a le verdi ali, 107 fuggì ’l serpente, e li angeli dier volta, 108 suso a le poste rivolando iguali.
query.error: **English:** 106 Hearing the air being beaten by the green wings, 107 the serpent fled, and the angels turned, 108 flying back up to their posts in equal formation.
query.result: 106 Gehyrende fleogan ðone lyft mid ðæm grene wænge, 107 fleah ða nædre, and ða englas gewendon, 108 up to ðæm postum fleogende efenlice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 L’ombra che s’era al giudice raccolta 110 quando chiamò, per tutto quello assalto 111 punto non fu da me guardare sciolta.
query.error: **English:** 109 The shade that had gathered to the judge 110 when he called out, during all that assault 111 was not loosed from my gaze for a moment.
query.result: 109 Se sceaða ðe ðam deman gegaderod wæs 110 ða he cleopode, ðurh ða ceastergeat 111 næfre fram ðære wæcce awendan wolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 «Se la lucerna che ti mena in alto 113 truovi nel tuo arbitrio tanta cera 114 quant’ è mestiere infino al sommo smalto»,
query.error: **English:** 112 "If the lamp that leads you on high 113 finds in your free will as much wax 114 as is needed to reach the highest enamel,"
query.result: 112 "Gif ðæt leoht ðe ðe lædeð on hehðe 113 fint on ðinum frumræde swilce weox 114 swa micel swa ðearf is oð ðone hehstan smylt,"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 cominciò ella, «se novella vera 116 di Val di Magra o di parte vicina 117 sai, dillo a me, che già grande là era.
query.error: **English:** 115 she began, "if you know any true news 116 of the Val di Magra or of a nearby region, 117 tell it to me, for I once lived there."
query.result: 115 ho ongan ða, "gif ðu soðne tiðan 116 of Mægre ðæm mægðe oððe neaweste 117 wast, sege ðu me, ðær ic wunode hwilum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «per li vostri paesi 122 già mai non fui; ma dove si dimora 123 per tutta Europa ch’ei non sien palesi?
query.error: **English:** 121 "Oh!" said I to him, "through your lands 122 I have never been; but where does one dwell 123 throughout Europe that they are not known?
query.result: 121 "Eala!" cwæð ic him, "ðurh eowre rīcu 122 næfre ær ne wæs; ac hwær wunað man 123 ðurh eall Europam ðe heora ne cunne?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 La fama che la vostra casa onora, 125 grida i segnori e grida la contrada, 126 sì che ne sa chi non vi fu ancora;
query.error: **English:** 124 The fame that honors your house 125 proclaims the lords and proclaims the region, 126 so that even those who have not been there know of it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e io vi giuro, s’io di sopra vada, 128 che vostra gente onrata non si sfregia 129 del pregio de la borsa e de la spada.
query.error: **English:** 127 and I swear to you, if I go above, 128 that your honored people do not disgrace themselves 129 in the value of the purse and the sword.
query.result: 127 and ic ðe swere, gif ic ofer síðe, 128 ðæt eower æðelu ne bið áwænded 129 on gesceapum sceatta and sweorda."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Uso e natura sì la privilegia, 131 che, perché il capo reo il mondo torca, 132 sola va dritta e ’l mal cammin dispregia».
query.error: **English:** 130 Custom and nature so privilege her, 131 that, though the chief be wicked and the world go astray, 132 she alone goes straight and scorns the evil way.
query.result: 130 Gewuna and gecynd swa heo geweorðað, 131 ðæt ðeah ðe heafod synnig weorðe and weoruld toweorpe, 132 heo ana gæð rihte and ðone unrihte weig forhogað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Ed elli: «Or va; che ’l sol non si ricorca 134 sette volte nel letto che ’l Montone 135 con tutti e quattro i piè cuopre e inforca,
query.error: **English:** 133 And he said: "Now go; before the sun sets 134 seven times in the bed that Aries 135 covers and bestrides with all four feet,
query.result: 133 And he cwæð: "Nu ga; ær ðam ðe sunne ne gesette 134 seofon siðum on ðam bedde ðe ðæt Ram 135 mid eallum feower fotum oferwreohð and oferstygð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 che cotesta cortese oppinïone 137 ti fia chiavata in mezzo de la testa 138 con maggior chiovi che d’altrui sermone,

query.result: 136 ðæt ðeos ðin arfæste gesceaft 137 bið ðe fæstnod on midre heafde 138 mid maran næglum ðonne oðres mannes spræc,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 se corso di giudicio non s’arresta».
query.error: **English:** 139 if the course of justice is not stopped."
query.result: 139 gif rihtes steorra ne bið gestaðelod."
